Travel & Hotel

Established as the first mountain resort in the Balkans by the royal family in 1896, Borovets Resort boasts 120 years of history and tradition. The newly renovated resort sits next to the slopers of the Rila Mountains.

EACH UDAYA LIVE TICKET INCLUDES THE FOLOWING RESORT AMMENITIES:
  • 3 Meals/Day
  • Room for 5 Days, 4 Nights
  • Spa
  • Ski lift
  • Hiking
  • Pool
  • Ropes Course
  • Workout Room

Each quad room sleeps up to 4 yogis, you can choose them or they can be random! It`s great way to make new friends for the festival.

See Ticket Options

Each double room is the perfect space for you and a friend. With nature surrounding the resort, every room has incredible views.

See Ticket Options

Want some time to recharge by yourself? Book a single room you`ll have an incredible, recently rannovated space all to yourself.

See Ticket Options

  • Seven Rila Lakes
  • Black Rock
  • Sofia
  • Rila Monastery
  • European Travel

Only 40km from Borovets, these glacial lakes are a sight to be seen! The Rila Mountains are believed to be a holy place where energy is spiritually heightened by natural beauty. Each year, on August 19, a group named the Danovites congregate to take part in a celebration of ritual rhytmic unison dancing in a large circle as the sun rises over the untouched land. Narrow streams connected the Seven Rila Lakes, leadingyou throughout a maze of crystal clear water in some of the highest peaks of the world.

At just a 4.5 km hike fromthe resort is the 100-meter balcony of Black Rock. This panoramic view captures the incredible, Maritsa River on the left, the field of Dolna Banya on the right, and looking up at Musala - the highest peak in the Balkan region.

Sofia, the capital city of Bulgaria, has incredible history that goes back over 7,000 years. Nesteld at the foot of the Vitosha mountain, Sofia has ancient ruins and modern attractions alike. This is the perfect chance to explore one of Europe`s oldest cities.

Founded in the 10th century and built by the students of Ivan Rilski (876-946), the monastery stands as a place of Bulgarian history and spiritual reflektion. The collection of work preserved in their libraries is one of the richest in the Balkan region and the architecture is breathtakingly phenomenal.

Bulgaria is a convenient jumping-off point for travel in both Western and Eastern Europe. A short extension of your travel time past the festival could easily find you anywhere from Budapest to Greece to Turkey.
